column4: my jack sense (plugging in a headset in the jack mutes the speakers) doesn't work in ubuntu (both have sound come out), but it works in windows. is there any way I can fix it?
file a bug
ubuntu-bug -s audio

I did that, but dev team said it's my motherboard and flag the problem invalid, and I said it works in windows. They said they will look into it and still leave the problem as invalid. I don't know what to do now.
dev team? which person
wait a second, let me see.
(hi, i'm one of the developers)
OMG, really? that's awesome. hope you can help me fix it this time. let me find the ticket for you.
audio's not my usual area, but...a lot of the bug triagers arent actually developers, so i want to look at the bug report
I can't seem to find the bug in my bugs section. is it because they flag it as invalid? where can I find it?
yes, use the advanced search
here is it: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/alsa-driver/+bug/643745
btw, I also installed ubuntu 10.10 and the jack sense still doesn't work, if that helps.
oh. what luke said makes sense.  desktops arent supposed to mute on headphone plugin, just laptops
is that so? but why windows can support jack sense for my MB?
its not a lack of detection. its behaviour
windows is deciding to mute it (for some reason... my win95 and winxp desktops didnt do that...)
so it's not possible to have jack sense for my computer under ubuntu? is there any way I can make it behave like windows?
i dont know any automatic settings for that... maybe somewhere in pulseaudio?
is my ubuntu using alsa right now? how do i switch it to  pulse?
pulse is installed by default. its an audio server on top of alsa (alsa being the driver)
thank for the info. i'm a linux n00b. :). where do I tweak its settings?
system -> preferences -> sound and you can install pavucontrol for extra control over devices
thanks. I will try that.
